intro: Lasiolytrum hirtum, commonly known as the hairy yellow-eyed grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers in late spring to early summer. Its inflorescence consists of a dense cluster of spikelets, which are characteristic of the Poaceae family. Lasiolytrum hirtum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of wetland habitats.
